text.p: These are the leading stories in the Mozambican press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- President Joaquim Chissano, opening a new health centre in Maputo, called for greater vigilance to stop dishonest doctors, nurses and orderlies from stealing hospital supplies and selling them on the black market.
- Nacala port director Agostinho Langa rejected allegations by a former South African army office that the port was being used as a conduit for weapons for Angola's former rebel UNITA movement.
